item.title: Sunken road surface opposite 191, 11th January
item.description:
See 14 inch ruler for scale. If duplicate please advise me of the original report. Otherwise please leave this open. Serious risk to road traffic. Approximately 2 inches deep 35 by 34 inches in size. Will report blocked drain in another report See photos.

item.description:

item.title: Flytipped large bed base, 11th January
item.description:
Further to report number 8662505 regarding the fridge freezer being flytipped. A large bed base has now been dumped on top of the above mentioned item overnight 11.01 2026 at the same location Side of the Candy Box Maple Crescent. Please can this be removed also as it is unsightly and a health hazard. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped street bin, 11th January
item.description:
This bin has been fly tipped here since the addition of the new eurobin outside Morriss House. Some people are still trying to use it as a bin so there is rotting rubbish in it. The what three words location is ///cool.pines.drew

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68-144, Cherry Garden Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken and missing bricks in pavement outside 233 Rotherhithe Street, 11th January
item.description:
Work was done recently to repair such issues on adjacent areas of pavement - particularly outside my own 233A front door, thank you for that. Since then this hole has appeared and is getting bigger. One brick has already disappeared and others will probably go too. I have tried to add a photo of the actual hole but for some reason it doesn’t work. The hole is visible in the location photo I have added of my neighbours house 233. It is a potentially serious trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 456A-440, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park gate not unlocked again this morning, 11th January
item.description:
Yesterday morning I was contacted to open the gates to the park, I was unable to get there until 11.30am to unlock them. I have just been called again, by a different local resident (Sunday 9.55am) to advise me that the gates to the park are locked and she is unable to walk her dog in the park. Please can you make sure that the park wardens unlock the gates in the morning as we have dog walkers, families, etc who have been unable to get to the park again this weekend. I am aware that this happened last weekend as well, but was reported by another person.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stolen street tree, 11th January
item.description:
An Amelanchier lamarckii planted just last November has been stolen . This isn’t casual vandalism , it appears to have been dug up and removed from the area . Can it please be replaced ? We haven’t got enough street trees around here anyway and need all we can get .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourdon Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just off the junction turning onto hawley cresent, 11th January
item.description:
One increasing large potentially dangerous pot hole and a second that is forming. Becoming harder to avoid and deep enough to be dangerous when I’m cycling my child to nursery. It’s been fixed badly many times and needs a proper repair as it opens up again within days /weeks each time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Hawley Crescent, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
